description.narrative: By 2015, government and local community capacities to promote and sustain girls' and boys' rights to protection from violence, exploitation and abuse are strengthened in humanitarian and post-conflict settings, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children in situations of natural disaster, armed conflict and Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) receive adequate family-based care and are protected fromviolence, abuse and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
